item.title: Boston 2018
item.author: hayden.macdonald.8778@gmail.com (Hayden MacDonald)
item.description: I recently travelled to Boston to attend Edward Tufte’s one day course, “Presenting Data and Information”. I learned about the course through twitter and read about Tufte, who is an esteemed professor emeritus of political science and statistics at Yale. As a future business analytics student, I was interested in taking a convenient one day course taught by a world expert in data visualization. The most enticing factor was that it seemed to be the most design-focussed course that I had read about.

item.title: The Case Against Young Link
item.author: hayden.macdonald.8778@gmail.com (Hayden MacDonald)
item.description: Melee! Super Smash Bros. Melee for the Nintendo GameCube was released in 2001. Since then, it has become one of the most adored games of the last twenty years. The game features many characters from various Nintendo game franchises, which players choose between before entering a match. The objective of each match is relatively simple: fight your opponent(s) and hit them beyond the boundaries of the stage. In contrast to fighting games, each time a player is struck they gain percentage points.
